title: Critter Profile: Diomedes
content:
[[module CSS]]
.email-example .collapsible-block-folded a.collapsible-block-link {
animation: blink 0.8s ease-in-out infinite alternate;
}
@keyframes blink {
0% { color: transparent; }
50%, 100% { color: #b01; }
}
.email {border: solid 2px #000000; width: 88%; padding: 1px 15px; margin: 10px; box-shadow: 0 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.5)}
.email-example a.collapsible-block-link {font-weight: bold;}
.tofrom {margin-left: 10px; margin-top: 5px; padding: 1px 15px; border-left: solid 3px maroon}
[[/module]]

[[include :scp-wiki:theme:wilsons]]
    
=====
[[include component:preview
text=
All hail the conquering heroes!
]]
=====

[[>]]
[[module rate]]
[[/>]]

[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Faeowayn Wilson
Recipient(s): All Staff
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Hey folks!

Just wanted you all to know we have a handful of new arrivals coming from the Supervisors. I get a sense there is quite a story there, but so far, they are staying tight-lipped as ever, except for us to expect more new friends in the near future. 

Not sure what they are doing over there, but it did come with an additional chunk of funding. 

Just from the jump, our new friends seem like a bit of a handful, but we've never failed to rise to a challenge before. Let's make them feel at home, yeah?
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
@@ @@
[[div class="wilson-border"]]
[[div class="wilson-header"]]
**Critter Profile: Diomedes**
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Overview!
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
[[f<image Diomedes.png width="300px" style="border:1px solid #665731;" title="Diomedes Charging"]]
@@ @@
@@ @@
**Name:** Diomedes

**Species:** //Equus ferus caballus//

**Primary Caretaker:** Jane Kaegen

**Diet:** Mixture of beef, pork, venison and oats. (Enjoys apples, but you need to be //really// careful about your fingers with this one!)

**Housed:** Wilson's Wildlife Center, Enclosure 43

@@ @@
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Creature Features!
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Diomedes is our name for the mare the Supervisors gifted to us, and, quite honestly, she is the most troublesome of the new arrivals. She's headstrong, for one, but also a bit of a prankster. She enjoys mock-charging the staff and visitors before pulling away and "laughing" at them, and that is quite a startling display, I have to admit.

That's because Diomede's main quirk is that she has a mouth of carnivoran, vaguely canine teeth that she readily uses to tear into all manner of meat presented to her. She has never gone out of her way to actually injure anyone under our employ so far, but as I said, it's better to be safe than sorry when it comes to your fingers when it comes to normal horses, let alone one with four-inch canines.  

Everything else about her seems to be as one could expect for a regular domesticated horse.
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
**History!**
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
[[=image diomedes2.png width="500px" style="border:1px solid #665731"]]
[[=]]
[[size 80%]]//Diomedes playing.//[[/size]]
[[/=]]
Diomedes came to us from the Supervisors working at Site-84 and was the last to get settled out of "this batch," This led us to believe that whatever they are doing, we should expect more new friends sooner rather than later. 

She has adapted well to her new home and seems to be doing fine in relative isolation, though we're thinking about introducing her to other equine members of the Center to see how well she gets on with normal horses. 

Outside of her apparent love of scaring her keepers and visitors, she has yet to injure anyone, even accidentally. However, due to her puckish nature, I think the idea that was floated to take her for rides would be best described as a mistake in the making.
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Special Needs and Accommodations!
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Enclosure 43 fit her well enough, but the fences need to be raised after she first arrived. She easily cleared the older arrangement and nearly took out Kaegan. That was also our first introduction to her "scare" tactics. Since the rise in height, she has yet to attempt something like that again.  

While she likes her mash well enough, a carcass should be introduced for enrichment every other week to allow her to forage as comes naturally to her. I also think we should consider treating her teeth like we do the big cats, just to make sure they stay healthy and undamaged. I can't say I've seen a horse with a toothache before, and I'm not sure if I want to!
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Notes about the Diomedes!
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Vet's Note: I had a hunch and checked her charts as well. She is fully healthy, with no signs of defects one should expect, even disregarding the altered digestion system. Guess what I did find, though? Heightened fertility. She's already a handful; I can't imagine how she will be when she goes into heat. Recommendation: Don't introduce her to any stallions!
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Jane Kaegen
Recipient(s): Faeowayn Wilson
Date: 07/10/22
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Hey, Boss, we're really going to need to update the fence around Diomedes's enclosure. A bunch of kids on a school trip accidentally antagonized someone's therapy dog, and it snapped at them. She had a bad reaction to that. I thought it was another of her typically mock charges. But she fully tried to go over the fence! I got in front of her, and she came close to running me down but stopped. She backed up, throwing her head, and... well, honestly, it sounded like growling. Spooked just bout everyone and they got away from the pen real quick, but I'm a bit worried about what she could have done.
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Faeowayn Wilson
Recipient(s): Jane Kaegen
Date: 07/10/22
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Alright, I'll get someone on that ASAP. Cal said he saw her prancing around at the back of her enclosure as well, kicking up a fuss about something. We keep treating her like a horse with an extra bell and whistle, but that might be a mistake. Keep an eye on her behavior, make notes, and let's see if we can figure out if she has some differing brain chemistry alongside those fangs of hers.
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Faeowayn Wilson
Recipient(s): All Staff
Date: 07/10/22
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Hey, folks, be on the lookout. One of our visitors came to the Center with their therapy dog, and somehow, the poor thing went missing on the premises. I know things around here are busy, but keep an ear to the ground, please. They're a terrier with black fur, very well-behaved, and that it got away from her at all is pretty surprising. She's desperate to get them back, so let's try and make that happen, yeah?
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Reggie Masters
Recipient(s): Faeowayn Wilson
Date: 07/11/22
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Hey, Fae, I fixed up Diomedes's fences as you wanted, and I think I found what she was nosing after. Deer corpse, a doe, covered in bite marks. I'm not sure what did it, but Diomedes was kinda stalking about, looking at it, sort of like a big cat. Kaegen said something about trying to figure out what makes her tick, and I'm wondering if there isn't a bit of a lion in there, you know what I mean.
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Faeowayn Wilson
Recipient(s): Reggie Masters
Date: 07/11/22
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Thanks for letting me know; I'll make sure her caretakers know to look out for other big cat-like behaviors that could lead to some... problems. 
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Jane Kaegen
Recipient(s): Faeowayn Wilson
Date: 07/13/22
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Boss! We have... something of a big problem over here at Enclosure 43. 

Do you know that service dog that went missing we have been looking for?

I found its collar in Diomedes's barn amongst the hay, and she's not here. There is a big hole in the back fence.

What do we do...

[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Faeowayn Wilson
Recipient(s): Jane Kaegen
Date: 07/13/22
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Oh gods! 

I was worried something like this could happen since Reggie mentioned the deer.

Well, obviously, we have to find her. I'll spread the word, tell folks to stop what they're doing if it isn't important and track her down.

After that, we'll have to check her stomach and compensate the owner. God, this is going to be so much paperwork. We should have been more careful; she's a horse, probably running on big cat software, and something like this was going to happen eventually.

This might lead to the Supervisors checking on us again...

Damn, damn, damn.

[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Jane Kaegen
Recipient(s): Faeowayn Wilson
Date: 07/13/22
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Fae! Wait!

It's going to be okay. I think we need to give Diomedes more credit.

She just wandered up to me, holding the dog by the vest with her mouth. He was covered in mud, freezing, and terrified but unharmed.

She did a little dance after I took the poor thing from her, acting mighty proud.

I don't think it's Big Cat software. I think it's Saint Bernard, lol.

So damage control will be a lot easier; just need to fix the fence she plowed clean through. Oh and figure out how she got the collar in the first place. 

[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Jane Kaegen
Recipient(s): Faeowayn Wilson
Date: 07/13/22
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
That's amazing! I'll call the owner immediately!

Don't worry about the fence; I'll have Reggie over to fix it immediately. Give that beauty all the apples and kisses from me as you can. She deserves it. Do try to figure out what happened with that collar, though!

[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Faeowayn Wilson
Recipient(s): Internal Record
Date: 07/23/22
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Diomedes is proving to be a much different animal than I first believed. 

We cleared up the incident with the dog; it turned out one of the kids was shit, stole it, and hucked it in a riverbed after stealing the collar. Surveillance shows him throwing it in Dio's pen, so... he's in for some fun with the sheriff, and Pete got an earful from me for missing all of that in the first place.

But since then, she's busted out three more times. The first, she came back to Kaegan with a pair of orphaned fawns. The time after that, she forced staff to follow her and helped them discover an injured eagle, and today, she got into a fight with //something// that got too close to Bakugo's enclosure. No clue what yet, but the claw marks looked deep, and there's always something out there in the woods. 

She's getting patched up now, and Kaegen and I have come to the same conclusion: she's part Bernard or Kangal, one of those big, burly livestock guardians or rescue dogs. I'm not sure where the Supervisors got her from, but I'm getting happier and happier to have her.  
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Jane Kaegen
Recipient(s): Faeowayn Wilson
Date: 09/14/22
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Hey, Boss, I just wanted you to know she's finally good with the saddle. The bridle is still a bit of an issue with her teeth, but I have a friend who is a bit of an amateur blacksmith and said he could put something together for me. Are you still game to see if she takes well being ridden around the Center's grounds?
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Faeowayn Wilson
Recipient(s): Jane Kaegen
Date: 09/12/22
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Hey, Janey

Go for it! 

Just be careful; no bridal means less grip if she takes off after something like last time.
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Boring Ranger Service
Recipient(s): Wilson's Wildlife Solutions
Date: 09/12/22
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Greetings. This message asks the members of WWS to offer their aid in the case of missing persons.

Hal Monts Jr, age 11, has gone missing along the hiking trails on North Mountain. He was last seen accompanying his father, who was discovered injured and delirious on the east trail. All able hands are desired to aid in the search. 
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Faeowyn Wilson
Recipient(s): All Staff
Date: 09/12/22
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
All right, folks, let's get to it! Who knows what could be out there this time?
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Reggie Masters
Recipient(s): Faeowyn Wilson
Date: 09/12/22
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
Kaegen and Dio just took off like a rocket
[[/div]]
[[/div]]



[[div class="wilson-border" style="margin-top: 7em;"]]
[[div class="wilson-subtitle"]]
Sent by: Faeowyn Wilson
Recipient(s): All Staff
Date: 09/12/22
[[/div]]
[[div class="wilson-body"]]
[[=image boringnews.png width="500px" style="border:1px solid #665731"]]
All hail the conquering heroes! (Might get a talking to from the Supervisors about this one, ngl.)

Also, we all know that wasn't a Mountain Lion; stay keen, folks. 
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
@@ @@
